Pai loves Koro more than anyone in the world, but she must fight him and a thousand years of tradition to fulfill her destiny.

programme.title: The Rendezvous
programme.desc: Rachel, a Jewish-American doctor and Jake, an Arab-American government bureaucrat, are trying to solve the mysterious death of Rachel's brother. Racing around the world, they find themselves hunted by a doomsday group. The group believes Rachel and Jake possess an ancient script discovered by Rachel's brother that could bring about the end of days. Caught in the middle of a plot to hasten the end of mankind, Rachel and Jake must solve a murder and save the world.

programme.title: Motherhood
programme.desc: A Manhattan mother of two finds herself in the midst of an epic, soul-crushing struggle when she sets out on a seemingly simple mission: arrange her two-year-old child's birthday party. Uma Thurman, Minnie Driver and Anthony Edwards star in this comedy about a "day from Hell.".

programme.title: The Girl On The Train
programme.desc: Rachel, who is devastated by her recent divorce, spends her daily commute fantasizing about the seemingly perfect couple who live in a house that her train passes every day. One morning she sees something shocking happen there and becomes entangled in the mystery that unfolds. Emily Blunt, Lisa Kudrow, Justin Theroux and Allison Janney star.

programme.title: The Thomas Crown Affair
programme.desc: Stylish remake of the 1968 crime caper about a millionaire playboy thief, Thomas Crown (Pierce Brosnan), who steals priceless works of art for the sheer, adrenaline-fueled fun of it, and the sexy insurance investigator (Rene Russo) who's both attracted to her suspect and determined to nab him. Denis Leary costars in this classy, witty thriller.

programme.title: Swing Away
programme.desc: Following a meltdown that leads to a suspension, professional golfer Zoe Papadopoulos travels to her grandparents' village in Greece to escape the harsh spotlight of the international sports world. Between baking bread and eating baklava, she meets and mentors a ten-year-old girl who is determined to become the next golf sensation. Along the way, Zoe rediscovers her Greek heritage, her love of the game and the hidden strength within herself.(n)

programme.title: The Longshots
programme.desc: A former high school football star gets his self-respect back when he lands a job coaching the local Pop Warner team with his athletically gifted niece as quarterback. Ice Cube stars in this sports comedy with Keke Palmer and Dash Mihok.(n)

programme.title: Halloween II (2009)
programme.desc: It's nearly Halloween again and the terrorized Laurie Strode awaits the dreaded return of her murderous brother Michael in this sequel remake starring Scout Taylor-Compton, Malcolm McDowell and Taylor Mane.(n)

programme.title: The Killer Inside Me
programme.desc: A deputy sheriff (Casey Affleck) in a small West Texas town of the 1950's tries with increasing desperation to hide his tortured, sadomasochistic affair with a prostitute (Jessica Alba), as well as the fact that he is a serial killer. Kate Hudson costars in this gritty, hard-boiled drama.(n)

programme.title: The Scarehouse
programme.desc: Two years after a tragic accident, six girls are invited to a party inside an elaborate Halloween funhouse. Once inside, they realize the true purpose of the event: to torture them as part of a revenge scheme. Corey and Elaina have spent their entire time in jail planning the elaborate payback since being solely blamed for the accident two years prior. As the night goes on, they all realize there is more to the scandal and cover-up than previously thought.(n)

programme.title: Cursed to Kill
programme.desc: Rachel awakens in a hospital, paralyzed from the waist down after a failed attempt on her life for abandoning a cult suicide. Her suffering grows as the spirits of the deceased members begin to haunt her within the confines of the hospital room. They threaten to kill her unless she is willing to offer up a kindred soul in place of her own - her brother's child. But the week that Rachel is given to make her decision is tethered to a curse. All who have the misfortune of hearing anything she says are met with a swift and violent death.(n)

programme.title: Despite the Falling Snow
programme.desc: In 1950s Moscow, communist Katya secretly spies for the Americans in the Cold War arms race. When she lands her biggest assignment, stealing secrets from rising government star Alexander, the last thing she expects is to fall in love with him. Reconciling her passion for him with her beliefs about communism means making the greatest sacrifice, a sacrifice that Alexander only uncovers thirty years later.(n)

programme.title: Two Weeks
programme.desc: A quartet of siblings gather at the North Carolina home of their dying mother, where squabbling, bickering, and ultimately, emotional healing and grace, are in the offing. Sally Field and Ben Chaplin lead the cast of this ensemble comedy-drama, costarring Julianne Nicholson and Tom Cavanagh.(n)

programme.title: The Pact
programme.desc: Nicole and Annie reluctantly return to their childhood home to pay their respects after their mother passes away. While staying overnight in the house, the sisters sense a mysterious presence in their midst - noises startling them in the night, objects moving about, a fallen picture of an unknown woman posed next to their mother. Annie begins experiencing a series of intense & disturbing dreams, and ­visions that lead to her mother's past finally revealing itself.(n)

programme.title: The Promise
programme.desc: Brilliant medical student Michael (Oscar Isaac) meets beautiful dance instructor Ana (Charlotte Le Bon) in late 1914. Their shared Armenian heritage sparks an attraction that turns into a romantic rivalry between Michael and Ana's boyfriend (Christian Bale), an American photojournalist. As the Ottoman Empire crumbles into war-torn chaos, their conflicting passions must be put aside as they join forces to get themselves to safety.(n)

programme.title: At the Devil's Door
programme.desc: When ambitious young real estate agent Leigh is asked to sell a house with a checkered past, she crosses paths with a disturbed girl whom she learns is the runaway daughter of the couple selling the property. Leigh tries to intervene and help her, but becomes entangled with a supernatural force that pulls Leigh's sister Vera into its web, and has sinister plans for both of them. Starring Naya Rivera, Ashley Rickards and Catalina Sandino Moreno.(n)

programme.title: Mistrust
programme.desc: Happy, beautiful and independent, Veronica enjoys being a mistress. No commitment, no strings and she never has to be vulnerable. She has carefully laid every brick in the walls of the fortress surrounding her heart. She's safe and having a great time. However, there is one person who knew her heart before those walls were erected, her best friend Brandon, who has stood by her for too many years to count. And while Veronica has tried to keep her feelings at bay, he is the one who holds the key that opens her Pandora's box of emotions.(n)

programme.title: The Truth About Lies
programme.desc: Gilby Smalls (Fran Kranz) is having a meltdown. He's just been fired from his job and his girlfriend gave him the boot. Forced to move in with May (Coleen Camp), his booze-swilling man-obsessed mother, he's desperate to turn things around. Gilby's luck seems to change when he meets Rachel (Odette Annable), the very thing Gilby needs to get his life back on track. Desperate to impress her, Gilby starts to weave a web of lies; one bigger than the next. Now in a sticky mess, Gilby is forced to face the uncomfortable truth about himself.(n)

Diagnosed with spinal cancer, 27 year old Adam (Joseph Gordon-Levitt) navigates the road to recovery with the sometimes-overbearing support of his crude best friend, Kyle (Seth Rogen), his smothering mother (Anjelica Huston) and an inexperienced therapist (Anna Kendrick). Inspired by a true story, 50/50 is an honest yet hysterically funny account of a young man's journey toward healing.(n)

programme.title: Robin and Marian
programme.desc: After 20 years gone from England, a middle-aged Robin Hood returns and resparks his relationship with Maid Marian (who's spent the years as a nun), reconnects with his Merry Men and renews his feud with the villainous Sheriff of Nottingham. (repeat) (cc).

programme.title: The Man Who Would Be King
programme.desc: Two cunning British soldiers of misfortune travel to a remote part of Afghanistan, where one of them is accepted as king and begins to believe his own deception, leading to disaster for himself and his faithful partner-in-crime after the ruse is inadvertently exposed. (cc).

programme.title: Desperate
programme.desc: Anthony Mann directed this tough film noir about a truck driver (Steve Brodie) who's framed for a robbery by a gangster (Raymond Burr) Audrey Long. Jan: Paul E. Burns. Pete: Douglas Fowley. Ferrari: Jason Robards. (cc).

programme.title: Ship of Fools
programme.desc: A motley group of passengers traveling from Mexico to Europe aboard a German ocean liner in 1933 become involved in each other's lives. (repeat) (cc).

programme.title: 21 Days
programme.desc: Vivien Leigh and Laurence Olivier teamed for this story about an accidental killing mistaken for murder. Keith: Leslie Banks. Mander: Francis L. Sullivan. Evan: Hay Petrie. Tolly: Robert Newton. Henry: Esme Percy. Antonio: Victor Rietti. MacPherson: Morris Harvey. Also known as "The First and the Last." Directed by Basil Dean.

programme.title: The Devil Is a Woman
programme.desc: Marlene Dietrich at her most glamorous as Concha, collector of hearts. Directed in high style by Josef von Sternberg. Lionel Atwill, Cesar Romero, Edward Everett Horton. Radiantly set at a Spanish carnival. (cc).

programme.title: Maytime
programme.desc: In the third pairing of "Singing Sweethearts" Nelson Eddy and Jeanette MacDonald, she portrays an opera star reminiscing about her career and a tragic romance with a street singer (Eddy) in Paris and later the U.S. The score was Oscar-nominated. (cc).

programme.title: Desperate
programme.desc: Anthony Mann directed this tough film noir about a truck driver (Steve Brodie) who's framed for a robbery by a gangster (Raymond Burr) Audrey Long. Jan: Paul E. Burns. Pete: Douglas Fowley. Ferrari: Jason Robards. (cc).

programme.title: A Family Affair
programme.desc: The first entry in the Hardy Family film series, which featured 15 sequels, revolves around patriarch Judge Hardy's reelection, which is threatened by a divorce scandal involving his daughter. Lionel Barrymore stars as the judge, but was replaced by Lewis Stone in the sequels.

programme.title: The Secret Garden
programme.desc: Shipped off to live at her uncle's gothic Victorian estate, an orphan one day discovers a mysterious, abandoned garden and devotes herself to restoring it, which helps to change the lives of the bitter man and her sickly, neglected cousin. (cc).

programme.title: Kiss Me Kate
programme.desc: A pair of divorced actors come together to star in a musical stage adaptation of Shakespeare's "The Taming of the Shrew," and soon find their feelings resembling those of the characters. (cc).

programme.title: Chitty Chitty Bang Bang
programme.desc: Chronicling the whimsical exploits of two children, their nutty-inventor father and his girlfriend in a flying auto in 1909 Britain. The musical gets a lot of mileage out of a tuneful tankful of songs by Richard M. and Robert B. Sherman, with the title number being Oscar nominated. Based on a collection of children's stories by James Bond creator Ian Fleming. (cc).

programme.title: Dawson City Frozen Time
programme.desc: This documentary looks back at the history of Dawson City, a Canadian town that sprung up during the Yukon gold rush, via recently restored film prints from the 1910s and '20s. (cc).

programme.title: Fragments
programme.desc: A collection of movie clips and reels from once-lost silents and early sound films that have been restored. Among them are the final reel of John Ford's "The Village Blacksmith" (1922); a segment of Best Actor Emil Jannings' performance in 1927's "The Way of All Flesh"; and snippets from lost treasures such as 1917's "Cleopatra," with Theda Bara, and 1919's "The Miracle Man," with Lon Chaney in the title role. (repeat) (cc).

programme.title: The Prisoner of Zenda
programme.desc: Silent adaptation of the classic novel about an Englishman vacationing in a Ruritanian country, where he is asked to stand in for his lookalike, the king, whose brother has kidnapped him and plans to usurp the crown.

programme.title: World on a Wire
programme.desc: In a futuristic world, a scientist working for a cybernetics conglomerate believes that the realm in which he lives may actually be a computer-run virtual reality, making the line between technology and humanity indistinguishable.

programme.title: MGM Parade Show
programme.desc: (repeat) (cc).

programme.title: The Hunchback of Notre Dame
programme.desc: Adaptation of the Victor Hugo novel is set in medieval Paris, where a deformed but kind bell ringer at a cathedral falls in love with a bewitching Gypsy who's given sanctuary in the church after being framed for murder by a jealous official. (cc).

programme.title: A Girl, a Guy and a Gob
programme.desc: Hijinks ensue when a pert stenographer is pursued by both her stuffy boss and a foot-loose sailor. (cc).

programme.title: The Big Land
programme.desc: A crooked cattle buyer has a beef with a Texas rancher who tries to convince Missouri farmers to establish a small town as a railroad link between the Rio Grande and Kansas City, thus seeing livestock prices increase. (cc).

programme.title: Up Periscope
programme.desc: Friction develops between sub commander Edmond O'Brien and naval demolitions expert James Garner. Sally: Andra Martin. Carney: Carleton Carpenter. Malone: Alan Hale. Standard service yarn. Gordon Douglas directed. (cc).

programme.title: A Cry in the Night
programme.desc: A frantic police search for a girl kidnapped by a psychopath.

programme.title: D.O.A.
programme.desc: Film noir told in flashback chronicles the story of an accountant who has 24 hours to find out who poisoned him before he dies. His investigation uncovers a ruthless gang that previously used the deadly poison during the commission of a crime. But a bigger question that remains is why was this seemingly innocent man targeted. (cc).

programme.title: Seven Days in May
programme.desc: Military brass conspire at top levels to overthrow the president, but a whistleblowing colonel uncovers the coup. Written by Rod Serling of "Twilight Zone" fame. (cc).

programme.title: Captains Courageous
programme.desc: Spencer Tracy won Best Actor as an earthy Portuguese fisherman who takes under wing a tycoon's spoiled young son who's fallen off a transatlantic luxury liner and been by a passing fishing boat. It's a coming-of-age adventure during which the lad learns lessons in respect, self-sufficiency and discipline. The Best Picture nominee is based on the Rudyard Kipling book. (cc).(n)

programme.title: Random Harvest
programme.desc: After losing his memory, a World War I vet starts a new life with a showgirl. But their happiness is threatened when an accident restores his former memories -- and his former life. (cc).(n)

programme.title: Performance
programme.desc: Kinky story of a rock star (Mick Jagger) and a mobster (James Fox). Pherber: Anita Pallenberg. Lucy: Michele Breton. Dana: Ann Sidney. (cc).(n)

programme.title: Thieves like Us
programme.desc: Director Robert Altman's acclaimed portrait of youthful romance and bank robbery in 1930s Mississippi. Keith Carradine. Keechie: Shelley Duvall. Chicamaw: John Schuck. T-Dub: Bert Remsen. Mattie: Louise Fletcher. Lula: Ann Latham. Dee: Tom Skerritt. (repeat) (cc).(n)

programme.title: They Live by Night
programme.desc: Two young criminal lovebirds try to escape from their past and the law, but find it tough to evade both. (cc).(n)

programme.title: A Kiss in the Dark
programme.desc: A neurotic concert pianist owns an apartment building populated by a number of wacky renters including a model. He has plans to kick them all out, but eventually is charmed by their personalities. (cc).(n)

programme.title: Bachelor Apartment
programme.desc: A playboy with too many conquests meets a woman who is special. (cc).(n)

programme.title: One for the Book
programme.desc: The wartime romance of a young actress (Eleanor Parker) and a GI (Ronald Reagan). Eve Arden, Wayne Morris, Kent Smith. Adapted from John van Druten's play "The Voice of the Turtle." Sophisticated fun. (cc).(n)

programme.title: Living on Love
programme.desc: A man and woman share an apartment without meeting; one uses it at night, the other during the day because of their jobs. As they grate on each other's nerves, they play ambitious practical jokes on one another. Based on a novel by John K. Wells. (cc).(n)

programme.title: George Washington Slept Here
programme.desc: Adaptation of the George S. Kaufman-Moss Hart Broadway hit about a city couple who buy a ramshackle Colonial-era farmhouse in upstate New York and their frustrating and costly attempts to renovate it. (repeat) (cc).(n)

programme.title: The Window
programme.desc: A young boy who is prone to lying claims to have witnessed a killing take place in a neighboring New York City apartment, but can't get anyone to believe him---except the murderers. The film is from a story by Cornell Woolrich, who wrote a similarly themed tale that was adapted for Hitchcock's "Rear Window." (cc).(n)

programme.title: Wait Until Dark
programme.desc: A blind woman inadvertently comes into possession of a doll stuffed with heroin and is targeted by three criminals who want to get their hands on the drugs. However, she proves to be more resourceful than the deadly trio expect. (cc).(n)

programme.title: The Apartment
programme.desc: An office worker loans his tiny New York City flat to his superiors for their secret romantic trysts and is subsequently promoted for maintaining silence about the affairs, but he runs into trouble when he gets involved with his callous boss' girlfriend. An Oscar winner for Best Picture and Director (Billy Wilder). (cc).(n)

programme.title: The Dark Knight Rises
programme.desc: In Gotham City, Bruce Wayne dons the Batman costume once again as the Dark Knight in order to battle Catwoman and Bane, a fierce foe possessed of tremendous physical and intellectual strength. (repeat) (cc).

programme.title: The Hobbit An Unexpected Journey
programme.desc: Bilbo Baggins, Gandalf the wizard and a group of dwarves seek a dragon's treasure, and encounter a series of incredible obstacles over the course of their epic journey. (cc).

programme.title: Watchmen
programme.desc: Adaptation of the graphic novel set in 1985 America, where a cadre of forced-into-retirement superheroes investigate the murder of one of their own and uncover a wide-ranging conspiracy. (cc).

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: Pride becomes convinced his nemesis "Baitfish" has returned and, in an attempt to locate him, instructs the team to investigate crime scenes and chase leads from New Orleans to Charleston, S.C. (repeat) (cc).

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: A sailor is killed in a strip club and the murder weapon is linked to two other unsolved homicides. In addition, the investigation reveals that the names of the three victims appear on a mural in a dilapidated part of town. Meanwhile, Brody's ex-fiancé pays her a surprise visit. (repeat) (cc).

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: Wade, Sebastian and Danny are taken hostage in the morgue when an armed man bursts in and demands the remains of a petty officer, who is thought to have died from natural causes. (repeat) (cc).

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: A Navy commander's car is stolen with his baby inside. The NCIS team investigate to determine whether it was a random carjacking or a targeted abduction. (repeat) (cc).

programme.title: The Hunger Games
programme.desc: After her younger sister is chosen to take part, 16-year-old Katniss Everdeen volunteers to compete in her place in a cruel televised tournament in which 24 teenagers from a postapocalyptic society fight to the death for the entertainment of the masses in a competition known as the "Hunger Games," which are broadcast across the nation as entertainment, and to reinforce the government's total power. (repeat) (cc).

programme.title: The Hunger Games Catching Fire
programme.desc: Katniss and Peeta sense growing unrest as they tour the country of Panem and prepare to participate in the 75th Hunger Games. Meanwhile, President Snow plots their downfall during preparations for the Quarter Quell, which only occurs every 25 years in celebration of the Capitol's victory over the districts. (cc).

programme.title: The Hunger Games Mockingjay, Part 1
programme.desc: Katniss ends up in District 13 following the Quarter Quell, and sets out to save Peeta while forging a fragile alliance with President Coin. Meanwhile, Katniss' courage becomes a source of inspiration to the downtrodden masses. (cc).

programme.title: The Hunger Games Mockingjay, Part 2
programme.desc: In the fourth and final installment of the "Hunger Games" saga, Katniss and her allies face their biggest challenge yet as the uprising sets its sights on revenge against President Snow during its siege of the Capitol. Meanwhile, Katniss must also deal with her brainwashed ex-lover and tensions with her current beau. (cc).

programme.title: The Last Ship *
programme.desc: The Season 5 premiere picks up three years after the global famine. The U.S. Navy is ready to unveil its first fully functional fleet since the Red Flu pandemic, but a new type of threat may mean the next world war. (cc).

programme.title: The Last Ship
programme.desc: The Season 5 premiere picks up three years after the global famine. The U.S. Navy is ready to unveil its first fully functional fleet since the Red Flu pandemic, but a new type of threat may mean the next world war. (repeat) (cc).

programme.title: Need for Speed
programme.desc: Street-racing mechanic Tobey embarks on a cross-country mission of vengeance against shady ex-NASCAR driver Dino, who framed him for a crime he didn't commit. Now, Tobey must enlist the help of car broker Julia to defeat Dino in a major underground race. (repeat) (cc).

programme.title: The Island
programme.desc: Intriguing sci-fi premise about cloistered clones who learn the truth about their purpose in life gets blindsided by director Michael Bay's pyrotechnics when two of them try to escape. (cc).

programme.title: TNT Network Preview
programme.desc: A backstage peek at TNT's original programming. (repeat) (cc).

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: A crossover episode that began on "NCIS" concludes with Agents McGee and Torres joining forces with the New Orleans team as they search for a missing homeland security theoretical-terror playbook. (repeat) (cc).

programme.title: Charmed
programme.desc: Despite Paige's optimism, Brody (Kerr Smith) remains skeptical about the Avatars' plans to revamp Earth into a utopia and makes a fateful bargain with the demonic Zankou (Oded Fehr). Directed by LeVar Burton. (repeat) (cc).

programme.title: Charmed

His tour now stops at bowling alleys and bars, and the booze is starting to compromise his health. But his life begins to turn around when he falls in love with a journalist (Best Supporting Actress nominee Maggie Gyllenhaal) and gets a call from a superstar protégé who asks him to write a new song. (repeat) (cc).(n)

programme.title: Away We Go
programme.desc: A thirtysomething couple (John Krasinski and Maya Rudolph) expecting their first child set off on a cross-country search for the perfect place to live. After learning that his parents are moving to Europe, the duo realize that they can lay down roots anywhere. They visit a number of old friends in different cities and learn valuable lessons about parenting. Directed by Sam Mendes. Maggie Gyllenhaal, Allison Janney, Jeff Daniels. (repeat) (cc).(n)

programme.title: Avatar
programme.desc: In this sci-fi epic, a paraplegic war veteran named Jake Sully volunteers for a mission on the planet Pandora, a hostile environment where human beings can only survive by remotely controlling alien avatars. However, Jake soon realizes that the Na'vi, a race of creatures native to Pandora, are being threatened by his own people, and he decides to join them in fighting back against mankind. (repeat) (cc).(n)

programme.title: Being John Malkovich
programme.desc: A frustrated puppeteer gains access to John Malkovich's brain via a small portal in his office. Later, a weird love triangle forms when he and his wife both have affairs with one of his coworkers while inhabiting Malkovich's body. (repeat) (cc).(n)

programme.title: Gifted
programme.desc: A bachelor named Frank tries his best to raise his 7-year-old niece Mary in rural Florida. But when it's revealed that Mary is a budding math prodigy, Frank gets into a custody battle with his mother over what's best for her future. (repeat) (cc).(n)

programme.title: The Boy Downstairs
programme.desc: An aspiring writer named Diana returns to New York after a three-year stint in Europe. She finds the perfect apartment, and when she discovers that her ex-boyfriend lives downstairs, she becomes interested in rekindling their relationship. (repeat) (cc).(n)

programme.title: Dunkirk
programme.desc: When 400,000 British and Allied troops end up trapped on the beaches of Dunkirk, France, following a catastrophic defeat during WWII, a number of civilian boats set out to rescue them before they are decimated by the approaching Nazi forces. (repeat) (cc).(n)

programme.title: The Final Destination
programme.desc: Terror comes at a frightening clip when a group of teens have a close brush with death at a racetrack, only to find the Grim Reaper striking back at them with a vengeance. (cc).

programme.title: Final Destination
programme.desc: When he has a vision of his flight to Paris crashing, a teen traveling with his French club makes a scene and they are all kicked off the airline. The plane goes down and the survivors are grateful, but Death hunts them down. (cc).

programme.title: Outcast
programme.desc: Kyle tries to get the family to safety as the town becomes overrun by the possessed, while Anderson takes Megan under wing, taking her to seek solace in an unusual spot. Later, Chief Giles realizes his wife has been resorting to desperate measures. (cc).

programme.title: The Broken
programme.desc: A woman is thrust into a world where everything is subtly unfamiliar in this thriller starring Lena Headey. Gina McVey is enjoying dinner with her family and her boyfriend Stefan when a mirror shatters without cause. The next day Gina sees a woman who looks like her own doppelganger. Curious, Gina sneaks into the woman's apartment and sees a photo of herself and her father. Later, Gina notices that Stefan is not the same and begins having horrific nightmares. (cc).

programme.title: Captivity
programme.desc: Sleazy thriller about a fashion model (Elisha Cuthbert) who is drugged, abducted and held prisoner by a mysterious stranger. Daniel Gillies, Pruitt Taylor Vince, Michael Harney, Laz Alonso, Maggie Damon. Roland Joffe directed. (cc).

programme.title: Halloween Resurrection
programme.desc: Eighth film in the series follows teens who spend the night in killer Michael Myers' childhood home as part of a contest set up by an entrepreneur. (cc).

programme.title: Jupiter Ascending
programme.desc: In this sci-fi epic in which human beings are the least-evolved species in the known universe, an ex-soldier protects a seemingly ordinary woman who's been targeted for assassination by a ruthless queen. (cc).

programme.title: The Diary of Anne Frank
programme.desc: The tragic plight of two Jewish families hiding from the Nazis in an Amsterdam attic. Joseph Schildkraut, Millie Perkins, Ed Wynn, Shelley Winters (Best Supporting Actress Oscar winner), Lou Jacobi, Richard Beymer, Gusti Huber, Diane Baker. (cc).

programme.title: The Water Diviner
programme.desc: In the Australian outback, a father gifted with the power to find water flowing underground fulfills a promise to his wife to locate their sons lost at the battle of Gallipoli. (cc).

programme.title: 50 First Dates
programme.desc: A Hawaii veterinarian falls for a woman with short-term memory loss. (cc).

programme.title: Little Nicky
programme.desc: Satan's bumbling son rises from the fiery depths of hell and enters New York City, where he tries to save the world and his father's life by battling his two supremely evil brothers, who are scheming to upset the balance of good and evil. (cc).

programme.title: Outcast
programme.desc: Kyle tries to get the family to safety as the town becomes overrun by the possessed, while Anderson takes Megan under wing, taking her to seek solace in an unusual spot. Later, Chief Giles realizes his wife has been resorting to desperate measures. (cc).

programme.title: Vampires Suck
programme.desc: In this irreverent parody of the "Twilight" series, smitten teen Becca is courted by two fierce rivals as the prom draws near, while her friends struggle to find dates to the dance. (cc).

programme.title: The Grudge
programme.desc: Director Takashi Shimizu's routine remake of his creepy Japanese thriller "Ju-on" stars Sarah Michelle Gellar as an American nurse in Tokyo who encounters a supernatural spirit spreading a deadly curse. (cc).

programme.title: The Italian Job
programme.desc: A team of high-class thieves set out to avenge their mentor's death with the help of his daughter. The plan consists of them stealing a fortune in gold, having it pilfered from them and then trying to get it back. (cc).

programme.title: The Losers
programme.desc: A team of mercenaries wage war on the CIA after they're double-crossed by rogue agent Max (Jason Patric) during a mission in the Bolivian jungle. But in order to get to Max, the team will need a little help from sexy operative Aisha (Zoe Saldana), who has her own reasons for joining the fight. (cc).

programme.title: Fast and Furious
programme.desc: When fugitive ex-con Dom Toretto returns to Los Angeles seeking the truth behind a high-profile crime, Agent Brian O'Conner reluctantly seeks out his help in order to take down a common enemy. Speeding from the streets of L.A. into the Mexican desert in convoy heists and precision tunnel crawls, Dom and Brian attempt to get their man while exploring thrilling new frontiers in the fine art of racing. (cc).

programme.title: Green Zone
programme.desc: Chief Warrant Officer Roy Miller deals with booby traps and cover-ups while searching for WMD in Iraq during the U.S. occupation in 2003. When Miller realizes that operatives on both sides of the conflict are attempting to spin the story in their favor, he searches for the facts that will either absolve a rogue regime or take the war to the next level. (cc).

programme.title: Self/less
programme.desc: A dying New York real-estate tycoon undergoes a top-secret procedure to transfer his consciousness into the body of a healthy young man, but he discovers that his new life isn't what he expected after severing ties to his old one and learning about the mysterious origins of his new body. (cc).

programme.title: Hard Candy
programme.desc: A 14-year-old girl (Ellen Page) and a thirtysomething photographer (Patrick Wilson) connect in an on-line chat room and arrange a meeting in this creepily provocative psychodrama that turns into an unsettling tale of retribution. Sandra Oh, Jennifer Holmes. Directed by David Slade. (cc).

programme.title: Larry the Cable Guy Health Inspector
programme.desc: The blue-collar comedy star doesn't git-r-done in this unsavory farce about the misadventures of a Florida public health inspector. Larry the Cable Guy, Iris Bahr, Bruce Bruce, Joanna Cassidy. Directed by Trent Cooper. (cc).

programme.title: Girl with a Pearl Earring
programme.desc: During the 1660s, a teenage maid (Scarlett Johansson) in the Netherlands becomes a model for painter Johannes Vermeer (Colin Firth). Absorbing and visually rich; the film nicely captures Vermeer's artistic process. Tom Wilkinson. The film scored three Oscar nominations, including Best Cinematography. Peter Webber's directorial debut. Based on the novel by Tracy Chevalier. (cc).

programme.title: The Hours
programme.desc: Three women, separated by 80 years, struggle with similar crises linked by the novel Mrs. Dalloway. Author Virginia Woolf attempts to start writing that novel, a '50s housewife contemplates leaving her life behind and a modern-day book editor cares for a former boyfriend who's fighting AIDS. (cc).

programme.title: The Pelican Brief
programme.desc: A law student is forced to go on the run after she uncovers an assassination plot based on a trail of murdered judges, a revelation which puts her own life in jeopardy. (cc).

programme.title: Big Trouble
programme.desc: The lives of a kooky collection of Miami residents interconnect in this adaptation of humorist Dave Barry's novel. A high-school boy accidentally crosses paths with two hitmen hunting a crooked businessman. Chaos ensues as the boy, the hitmen, two confused cops, two petty robbers, and the Russian mob all get tangled up with one another. (cc).

programme.title: Why Him?
programme.desc: An adoring dad is horrified to discover that his daughter's tech-billionaire boyfriend is a tattooed, party-hearty lout. Despite the latter's heart of gold, the father refuses to warm to him—especially when he learns about his engagement plans. (cc).

programme.title: Back to the Future
programme.desc: An eccentric scientist builds a time machine, which accidentally transports a high-school student back to the 1950s, where the teen inadvertently interferes with the budding romance between his future parents. The boy must figure out how to set things right, or risk completely altering the future. (cc).

programme.title: Assassin's Creed
programme.desc: In this adaptation of the popular video-game series, a death-row convict relives his ancestor's memories as an assassin in 15th-century Spain. From this out-of-body experience, he gains the training he needs to battle a conspiracy in the present day. (cc).

programme.title: Terminator Salvation
programme.desc: Set in the year 2018, John Connor leads the human resistance against the computer network Skynet as the machines grow more aggressive than ever before. John was raised to believe in a specific version of the future, but that future begins to shift with the appearance of mysterious former death-row inmate Marcus Wright. As John and Marcus venture into the mechanical heart of Skynet's operations, they make a terrifying discovery about the potential fate of the human race. (cc).(n)

programme.title: A Time to Kill
programme.desc: Absorbing adaptation of John Grisham's first novel, about a white lawyer defending a black man who's on trial for killing his daughter's rapists in a racially divided Mississippi town. (cc).(n)

programme.title: The Cooler
programme.desc: A lifelong loser (William H. Macy), employed by a Las Vegas casino to stop gamblers' hot streaks, gets lucky in love. Deftly acted, well-written drama with Maria Bello and Alec Baldwin (Best Supporting Actor nominee). Directorial debut for co-screenwriter Wayne Kramer, who was nominated for a Grand Jury Prize at the Sundance Film Festival. (cc).(n)

programme.title: W.
programme.desc: Josh Brolin gives a pitch-perfect performance as President George W. Bush in Oliver Stone's surprisingly restrained biopic tracing Bush's transformation from a privileged, partying frat boy to a born-again Christian and conservative politician. Elizabeth Banks, Ellen Burstyn, James Cromwell, Richard Dreyfuss. (cc).(n)

programme.title: The Quiet American
programme.desc: Superbly acted adaptation of Graham Greene's novel about the complex friendship between a British journalist and an American agent in 1952 Vietnam. Michael Caine (who was nominated for an Oscar), Brendan Fraser. Directed by Phillip Noyce on location. A less faithful film version was made in 1958, starring Michael Redgrave and Audie Murphy. (cc).(n)

programme.title: Trouble No More
programme.desc: A chronicle of Bob Dylan's "gospel" period, which spanned the album trilogy "Slow Train Coming" (1979), "Saved" (1980) and "Shot of Love (1981), features concert footage in Toronto and Buffalo in 1980; and sermons written by Luc Sante and delivered by Michael Shannon. (cc).(n)

programme.title: Dave
programme.desc: An employment-agency owner is enlisted to impersonate the President to avoid a scandal when an extramarital dalliance leads to a mishap that puts the commander in chief in a coma. (cc).(n)

programme.title: Collateral Beauty
programme.desc: A New York adman deals with the pain of losing a child by writing letters to Time, Death and Love. He is soon visited by representations of the three concepts, and they, along with his close friends, help him return to some semblance of a normal life. (cc).(n)

programme.title: An Affair to Remember
programme.desc: A man and woman meet and fall in love while aboard an ocean liner en route to New York. They agree to meet at the top of the Empire State building in six months to resume their romance provided they've both ended their current respective relationships. Remake of the 1939 classic “Love Affair.” (cc).(n)

programme.title: Hannah and Her Sisters
programme.desc: Woody Allen wrote, directed and stars in this relationship comedy about three Manhattan sisters and the men in their lives. One of the women suspects her husband of lusting after her youngest sister. Oscars went to Allen for his screenplay and to supporting actors Dianne Wiest and Michael Caine. (cc).(n)

programme.title: West Side Story
programme.desc: Rival New York street gangs war in Manhattan over turf boundaries while two youths fall in love, but they are from opposing groups. (cc).(n)

programme.title: Serendipity
programme.desc: A couple (John Cusack, Kate Beckinsale) decide to let fate determine if they are meant for each other. Charming but contrived essay about love and destiny. Eugene Levy steals scenes as an uptight salesman. Directed by Peter Chelsom. (cc).(n)

programme.title: Annie Hall
programme.desc: Woody Allen cowrote and directed this Best Picture, and stars as a neurotic Jewish comedian and writer recounting the roller-coaster relationship he had with a kooky, WASPish aspiring singer. The film employs fantasy flashbacks, direct-to-camera monologues, subtitles and even a cartoon sequence to tell its tale. (cc).(n)

programme.title: Weekend at Bernie's
programme.desc: A boss invites two underlings to his beach house with the intention of having them killed because they uncovered his illegal activities. However, when they arrive and discover the boss himself is dead, the pair spends the weekend pretending he's alive so that they can enjoy the place and figure out how to get themselves out of harm's way. (cc).

programme.title: Birth of the Dragon
programme.desc: In 1964 San Francisco, a pre-fame Bruce Lee challenges a Shaolin monk named Wong Jack Man to a fight behind closed doors. This drama depicts this real-life event, which helped cement Lee's reputation as one of the greatest martial artists of all time. (cc).

programme.title: Cape Fear
programme.desc: Sadistic ex-con Max Cady seeks revenge on the defense attorney who acted unethically in order to ensure he went to jail. (cc).

programme.title: The Statement
programme.desc: High-minded but muddled thriller about a former Nazi collaborator (Michael Caine) trying to avoid capture by the French government and death by vengeful assassins in the 1990s. Tilda Swinton. Directed by Norman Jewison. Adapted from Brian Moore's fact-based novel by screenwriter Ronald Harwood. (cc).

programme.title: The Beach
programme.desc: An American vacationer and a French couple find danger on a secluded island paradise off the coast of Thailand. (cc).

programme.title: Volcano
programme.desc: Action flick about an emergency chief and a geologist who scramble to halt the destruction of L.A. from a volcanic eruption. (cc).

programme.title: Back to the Future Part II
programme.desc: A teen time-travels from 1985 to 2015 in order to save his parents and his children from the disasters precipitated by his own mistake when he traveled to 1955 and bought a book in order to enrich himself in the future. (cc).

programme.title: Corky Romano
programme.desc: A bumbling veterinarian joins the FBI so he can destroy evidence against his mob-boss father. (cc).

programme.title: Snatched
programme.desc: A free-spirited woman convinces her anxious mother to join her on a vacation to South America she'd been planning with her beau before they broke up. However, their trip turns into a wild adventure when they escape from an attempted kidnapping. (cc).

programme.title: Courage Under Fire
programme.desc: “Rashomon”-like flashbacks lend depth to this military drama, which centers on a scrupulous Army officer (Denzel Washington) probing the Gulf War death of a chopper pilot (Meg Ryan). Monfriez: Lou Diamond Phillips. Hershberg: Michael Moriarty. Ilario: Matt Damon. Bruno: Bronson Pinchot. Edward Zwick directed. (cc).

(cc).(n)

programme.title: Outcast

programme.title: Bywanie na dywanie
programme.desc: Paulina Koziejowska i Aleksandra Kot zagłębiają się w świat przemysłu rozrywkowego. Opowiadają o bieżących wydarzeniach z show-biznesu, najświeższych plotkach oraz najgłośniejszych skandalach. Stałymi gośćmi programu są Adrian Nychnerewicz, redaktor "Super Expressu", który podzieli się najnowszymi wieściami z czerwonego dywanu, oraz Michał Kozłowski z Nowa TV, który zdradzi sekrety gwiazd sportu. Widzowie znają już obie gospodynie programu jako prezenterki prognozy pogody na Nowej TV, oprócz tego Aleksandra Kot od kilku lat jest związana ze stacją Eska TV.

programme.title: Bywanie na dywanie
programme.desc: Paulina Koziejowska i Aleksandra Kot zagłębiają się w świat przemysłu rozrywkowego. Opowiadają o bieżących wydarzeniach z show-biznesu, najświeższych plotkach oraz najgłośniejszych skandalach. Stałymi gośćmi programu są Adrian Nychnerewicz, redaktor "Super Expressu", który podzieli się najnowszymi wieściami z czerwonego dywanu, oraz Michał Kozłowski z Nowa TV, który zdradzi sekrety gwiazd sportu. Widzowie znają już obie gospodynie programu jako prezenterki prognozy pogody na Nowej TV, oprócz tego Aleksandra Kot od kilku lat jest związana ze stacją Eska TV.

programme.title: Octonauts
programme.sub-title: Octonauts Special: The Great Swamp Search
programme.desc: The gang journeys to the Florida Everglades to help Tweak's Dad, Ranger Marsh, track down several invasive species - including a Burmese Python and her babies.

programme.title: Tree Fu Tom
programme.desc: It is the annual sticky bug migration season in Treetopolis with the streets full of swarming insects. They seem harmless but if touched they will attach themselves and not let go.

programme.title: Biggleton
programme.desc: Odd Job Shardae races to get lots of jobs done, but things go wrong when all the chickens escape. The search is on to find them, even though they are hiding all over Biggleton.

programme.title: Justin's House
programme.desc: After getting comfortable in his new home, Justin wants to throw a housewarming party, but Little Monster is in a cheeky mood and Robert the Robot has turned the heating up to full.

programme.title: Andy's Dinosaur Adventures
programme.desc: The presenter goes back in time to collect a fern for the museum, and meets a large Diplodocus dinosaur.

programme.title: Do You Know
programme.sub-title: Fire Engine Hose and Reflective Strips
programme.desc: Maddie Moate looks at the emergency services. She uses a special camera to find out how the hose on a fire engine works and how the pump inside the fire engine creates pressure and sends water to the hose. Next, Maddie sees how an ordinary white car is made into a police car using special blue and yellow reflective stickers. A microscope camera reveals the tiny prisms inside the stickers, which make them bright and shiny.

programme.title: Waffle the Wonder Dog
programme.desc: The Brooklyn-Bells decorate Doug's bedroom. Waffle tries to help but causes a green paint disaster and escapes into Mrs Hobbs' house next door.

programme.title: Little Roy
programme.sub-title: Now You See It, Now You Don't
programme.desc: Roy is delighted when Becky invites him to play with her dollhouse. However, Roy lets his imagination run away with itself and ends up breaking Becky's beloved toy. Becky is upset when Roy refuses to apologise and she starts ignoring him; as time goes by, Roy begins to disappear. Roy thinks this is the best game ever! He sets about pranking his family and neighbours with his invisibility. Eventually though, Roy wants to be seen again. His family and neighbours try to help with some novel solutions. But when none of them work, Roy begins to worry, will he be invisible forever?

programme.title: Little Roy
programme.desc: Becky gives Roy a brand new set of doctor's equipment, and he eagerly sets about curing everyone's maladies - both real and imagined.

programme.title: I Can Cook
programme.sub-title: I Can Cook on the Go: Half Time Ices/Football
programme.desc: Katy Ashworth and her culinary helpers play football together, then make `half time ices'.

programme.title: Teacup Travels
programme.desc: Great Aunt Lizzie tells the story of Lokesh and the Adventure of the Greek Comedy Mask, which features a special gift for celebrated Ancient Greek actor Gregorious.

programme.title: Melody
programme.desc: Melody has fun in the garden with the sprinkler, but her feet get cold and muddy, so mum suggests a game of elephants instead.

programme.title: Woolly & Tig
programme.desc: Tig is given a bicycle for her birthday, but will not take advice from her mother on how to ride it.

programme.title: Down on the Farm
programme.desc: Storm Huntley goes to a farm in Northamptonshire to find out all about the world's biggest birds - ostriches. JB Gill discovers how cobnuts are grown and gathered in Kent.

programme.title: Where in the World
programme.sub-title: Mario, Tyra and Liza: Tyra Builds Sandcastles at the Beach
programme.desc: In Italy, Mario, who's seven, spends Saturday cleaning prawns ready for customers at his dad's fish shop. On a hot day in Ghana, five-year-old Tyra cools off at the beach, and builds a massive sandcastle. And in Russia, seven-year-old Liza and her twin brother, Styopa, build a giant plastic tower, only to see it knocked down by their little sister Yulia. We see that although children live in different countries, may look different and speak different languages, the joys and challenges of childhood are universal.

programme.title: My Story
programme.desc: Daddy Damien shares his memories with Georgia, reflecting on the fun he had being brought up in a Scottish castle.

programme.title: Ferne and Rory's Vet Tales
programme.desc: Rory meets Sophia whose cat, Oscar, is getting a check-up at the vets before trying a new treatment, while Ferne visits a zoo vet who is checking on their arctic fox.

programme.title: Tinga Tinga Tales
programme.desc: African folk tale about how the camel got its hump.

programme.title: Something Special
programme.sub-title: Something Special: We're All Friends: Counting
programme.desc: Mr Tumble is counting fish with Fisherman Tumble, while Justin and his friends are counting animals at a wildlife park.

programme.title: Andy's Baby Animals
programme.desc: Andy Day knows young animals make great climbers. In North America black bear cubs must learn the right tree. A slippery river bank is a challenge for giant river otters in Brazil. In Israel special goats called ibex face a clifftop walk.

programme.title: Junk Rescue
programme.desc: Danny finds some torn plastic bags that can't be used any more and takes them to Karl the Engineer. Zoe and the Junkyard Helpers make useful items from cardboard egg boxes.

programme.title: Peter Rabbit
programme.sub-title: The Tale of the Greedy Fox
programme.desc: Peter tells a compulsive lie, and must stop Jemima Puddle-Duck from becoming the fox's dinner.

programme.desc: The four adventure-seeking superheroes spring into action when the foghorns from San Francisco's Golden Gate Bridge go missing.

programme.title: Rastamouse
programme.desc: The friends investigate Geekamouse's new brand of Techno watches, after a group of mice wearing the devices turn up late to an important meeting.

programme.sub-title: Posting a Letter and Colouring Pencils
programme.desc: In today's episode, Maddie is sending a letter in the post to the CBeebies house. She finds out how posting a letter works as she follows the letter's journey from the post box to the sorting office and finally to the house. Using a special infrared light, Maddie shows us how stamps are scanned to tell if they are first or second class. Next, she visits a factory where colouring pencils are made. She finds out how the coloured crayon inside is made from clay and, using her slow-motion camera, we see the wooden shaft of the pencil being made.

programme.title: Do You Know
programme.desc: In today's episode, Maddie is having a party! She finds out how bubbles work when we blow into bubble mixture. She shows us how the surface tension of water changes when we add soap and how we can stop bubbles from bursting with our hands, and using her slow-motion camera, she shows how bubbles make a sphere shape. Next, Maddie heads to a factory where a party favourite is made - chocolate! We learn how chocolate starts out as a fruit, and we see the chocolates being made for an assortment box. Maddie also uses her special camera to see the super-fast robots that put the different chocolates into the right holes in their boxes.(n)

programme.title: Bitz & Bob
programme.desc: Bob can't go to his friend Phoebe's party because she has measles. This puts a stop to his aim to try and beat his previous record of shooting 4 basketball hoops in a row. Bitz decides to throw the best beach party ever to make up for it. There are snacks, games, a dance floor and even a basketball hoop! But it's a very warm day and soon everyone is too hot to party. Will they have to give up and call it a day or can Bitz find a way to cool everyone down so that Bob can try and beat his record?(n)

programme.title: Apple Tree House
programme.desc: Aamir Tai, Miranda Sarfo Peprah, Eden Gough, William Vanderpuye, Shaheen Khan, Sahana Rameswaran-Kangesan. Preschool drama series about children living on an extraordinary inner-city estate. David is super-excited at the prospect of writing a poem for the Apple Tree community poetry event. As David tries to write about his trains, he also tries to convince his friend Laila to take part too, but no matter how hard he tries, Laila remains determined not to participate. Eventually David, with Grandma Zainab's help, works out that Laila's problem isn't stage fright but more to do with her difficulties with reading. However, David is able to rely on Mali and their friends to find a solution that allows Laila to participate.(n)
